comment._content: Ohio Democratic politician, strong ally of Woodrow Wilson, and appointee of Wilson for Secretary of War, a position in which he served from March 9, 1916 to March 4, 1921. Pancho Villa raided Columbus, New Mexico, killing or wounding 15 Americans (depicted in nearby Bain photos) on Baker's first day in office, an act that Baker considered Villa's test of him, and Baker authorized General Pershing's expedition to capture Villa. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F50710F93B5B17738...; en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newton_D._Baker His 1937 New York Times obituary: select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F0091FF93A59177A...; His wife was Elizabeth Wells Leopold Baker. His son was Newton D. Baker III. One of his daughters was Elizabeth Baker (Mrs. John Phillips) McGean of Cleveland, the other was Margaret Baker (Mrs. Fulton) Wright of St. Louis. www.wvculture.org/history/government/bakernewton01.html ech.case.edu/cgi/article.pl?id=BND
